    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonConfig

        public JsonConfig(java.io.File pluginDataFolder,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        pluginDataFolder - The plugin's data directory, accessible with JavaPlugin#getDataFolder();
        name - The name of the config file excluding file extensions. Please notice that the constructor does not yet create the JSON-configuration file. To create the file on the disk, use createConfig().
        Since:
        2.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • createConfig

        public void createConfig()
        Since:
        2.0.0 This creates the configuration file. If the data folder is invalid, it will be created along with the config file.

      • getDirectory

        public java.io.File getDirectory()
        Returns:
        The configuration file's directory. To get its name, use getName() instead.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of the configuration file, including file extensions. This returns the name of the configuration file with the .yml extension. To get the file's directory, use getDirectory().
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Returns:
        The config file. This returns the actual File object of the config file.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile()
        Since:
        2.0.0 This deletes the config file.

      • deleteParentDir

        public void deleteParentDir()
        Since:
        2.0.0 This deletes the config file's directory and all it's contents.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Since:
        2.0.0 This deletes and recreates the file, wiping all its contents.

      • wipeDirectory

        public void wipeDirectory()
        Since:
        2.0.0 Wipe the config file's directory, including the file itself.

      • createSubDirectory

        public void createSubDirectory(java.lang.String name)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        name - The sub directory's name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the entered string has a file extension or already exists. This will create a sub-directory in the plugin's data folder, which can be accessed with getDirectory(). If the entered name is not a valid name for a directory or the sub-directory already exists or the data folder does not exist, an IOException will be thrown.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isJSONObject

        public boolean isJSONObject()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns:
        true if the content of the file may be parsed as a JSONObject.JSONObject(). If not, false will be returned. Checks whether or not the plain text inside the file may be parsed as a valid JSONObject.JSONObject(). If the file contain a JSONArray.JSONArray() , false will be returned. If the content does not contain a valid JSON structure, the function will return false as well.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isJSONArray

        public boolean isJSONArray()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns:
        true if the content of the file may be parsed as a JSONArray.JSONArray(). If not, false will be returned. Checks whether or not the plain text inside the file may be parsed as a valid JSONArray.JSONArray(). If the file contain a JSONObject.JSONObject(), false will be returned. If the content does not contain a valid JSON structure, the function will return false as well.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is invalid.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • toJSONObject

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject toJSONObject()
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                               org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Returns:
        the contents of the file as a JSONObject.JSONObject().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is invalid.
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - , IOException, FileNotFoundException if the file does not contain a valid JSONObject.JSONObject() or cannot be found. This creates and returns a new JSONObject.JSONObject(), with the contents of the file.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • toJSONArray

        public org.json.simple.JSONArray toJSONArray()
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                             org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Returns:
        the contents of the file as a JSONArray.JSONArray(). This creates and returns a new JSONArray.JSONArray(), with the contents of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is invalid.
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - If the file does not contain a valid JSONArray.JSONArray().
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • putInJSONObject

        public void putInJSONObject(java.lang.Object k,
                            java.lang.Object v)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Parameters:
        k - The key.
        v - The value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the file cannot be found.
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - Thrown when the file does not contain a valid JSONObject.JSONObject(). Adds a new key-value to the JSONObject inside getFile().
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • putInJSONObject

        public void putInJSONObject(java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object> values)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Parameters:
        values - The Map with all the values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the file cannot be found.
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - Thrown when the file does not contain a valid JSONObject.JSONObject(). Adds all the keys and values of the Map to the JSONObject inside getFile().
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • putInJSONArray

        public void putInJSONArray(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> c)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Parameters:
        c - A collection which holds the objects to add to the JSONArray.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the file cannot be found.
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - Thrown when the file does not contain a valid JSONArray.JSONArray(). Adds all the values of the collection to the JSONArray inside getFile().
        Since:
        2.0.0
